skillTree.localised_description: The finest steed Salzenmund has to offer is gifted to the Nordmarshal by it's people.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Salzenmunders venerate Gnistre as patron of the silver trade and the wealth it brings. He’s typical of minor gods  across the Empire — obscure, local, and limited to a very specific purview.
The Nordmarshal is both a ceremonial and a military position within Nordland, the one who holds the title is considered the most important person in Nordland, after the Grand Baron - obviously.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Infantry units
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Fredhoff started as a marine a board one of the Empire's Wolfships, his shipmates from past days still fight along side him, now nicknamed ''Gunter's Raiders''.
Known for it's brizzling fur trade, Dietershafen is not just the Empire's navy home port, it's also the best place to stock up on Northern furs.
Few state armies have seen more combat as Nordlands, fighting off the constant threat of the North with it's many marauders batterig on the Empire's shores.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +5 for Melee Infantry units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fredhoff is a veteran campaigner who has led Nordlandic troops deep into Norscan territories, his steadfast allure a source of inspiration for his troops.

effects.description:
Leadership: +8 when laying siege or encircling
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few outside Nordland know the legend of the Haugfylk, a group of ancestral spirits consisting of Nordland's fiercest warriors, only appearing to those worthy in their eyes. They have appeared to both Gausser, Nikse and Fredhoff - only when times are grave.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

items.colour_text: Long stretched are the Silver Hills that form the backbone of Nordland, named after the precious minerals they harbor in abundance. They are hard to traverse, yet the Nordmarshal understands the vital importance of Nordland's state army being able to manoeuvre them. All Nordland regiments are put to the test when they are tasked to cross the Silver Hills at the end of their training, the regiment that does so the quickest is rewarded with the revered Banner of the Silver Hills.

Holtz Weisser is well respected among Nordland's state army and is tasked with guarding ''Old Piet'', the great bell that hangs high in Salzenmund - Old Piet is said to echo further than the eye can see and is therefore incremental in warning the surrounding towns and villages of any incoming Norscan raids. Holtz Weisser carries a tall greatsword and has earned his stripes serving the Nordmarshal in the far reaches of Norsca.

effects.description:
Weapon Strength: +15% for Nordland Greatswords
	(Lord's army)

items.colour_text: Count Alfrich-Gausser Ostrein — A grim pragmatist who used diplomatic skill to open up the city and foster trade. He inherited the enchanted axe of Ostrein, oozing with magic harvested from colder regions. When High Kinf Helvar Ironaxe besieged Salzenmund, instead of lifting his axe to fight - Alfrich hid in his wine cellar. He was disowned of his axe as punishment, it was only to be wielded by the Nordmarshal ever since.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: As Nordmarshal Gunter Fredhoff is the highest ranked military officer of Nordland, and the commander of the Provincial State Army.

enabled_if: Unit vigour is worse than winded
